## Pedagogical Validation

**4-Layer Framework Adherence**:
- ✅ Lessons 1-2: Layer 1 (Manual Foundation) - No AI, build intuition
- ✅ Lessons 3-6: Layer 2 (AI Collaboration with Three Roles) - Active collaboration
- ✅ Lessons 7-8: Layer 3 (Intelligence Design) - Skills creation
- ✅ Lesson 9: Layer 4 (Spec-Driven Integration) - Full capstone

**Teaching Modality (Anti-Convergence)**:
- ✅ Primary: Collaborative parameter tuning (Lessons 3, 4, 6)
- ✅ Secondary: Specification-first (Lessons 2, 5, 9)
- ✅ Distinct from Part 2 and Part 3 Ch7-8 modalities

**Cognitive Load Compliance**:
- Lessons 1-2 (B2): 7-8 concepts ✅
- Lessons 3-6 (B2-C1): 7-8 concepts each ✅
- Lessons 7-9 (C1): 8-10 concepts ✅

## Lesson Summaries

### Lesson 1: Nav2 Architecture and Component Overview
- **Estimated time**: 90 minutes
- **Layer**: 1 (Manual Foundation)
- **Content**: Nav2 components (costmaps, planners, controllers, BT), lifecycle management
- **Exercises**: Install Nav2, explore TurtleBot3 demo, examine configuration files

### Lesson 2: Costmap Configuration for Humanoid Footprint
- **Estimated time**: 120 minutes
- **Layer**: 1 (Manual Foundation)
- **Content**: Costmap layers, footprint calculation, inflation radius, sensor integration
- **Exercises**: Specification-first footprint definition, RViz visualization

### Lesson 3: Path Planner Selection for Bipedal Gait
- **Estimated time**: 150 minutes
- **Layer**: 2 (AI Collaboration)
- **Content**: Navfn vs Smac vs TEB, bipedal kinematic constraints, weight tuning
- **Three Roles**: Teacher (kinematics), Student (stability), Co-Worker (weight balance)

### Lesson 4: Controller Configuration for Humanoid Tracking
- **Estimated time**: 150 minutes
- **Layer**: 2 (AI Collaboration)
- **Content**: DWB controller, velocity limits, acceleration limits, tracking error
- **Three Roles**: Teacher (velocity from gait), Student (acceleration safety), Co-Worker (critic weights)

### Lesson 5: Behavior Tree Design for Navigation Logic
- **Estimated time**: 180 minutes
- **Layer**: 2 (AI Collaboration)
- **Content**: BT fundamentals, recovery escalation, humanoid-safe recovery speeds
- **Three Roles**: Teacher (BT syntax), Student (escalation validation), Co-Worker (XML implementation)

### Lesson 6: Dynamic Obstacle Avoidance and Replanning
- **Estimated time**: 150 minutes
- **Layer**: 2 (AI Collaboration)
- **Content**: Costmap update rates, replanning triggers, safe stop, social navigation
- **Three Roles**: Teacher (pipeline timing), Student (safe distance), Co-Worker (parameter tuning)

### Lesson 7: Creating Nav2 Humanoid Configuration Skill
- **Estimated time**: 180 minutes
- **Layer**: 3 (Intelligence Design)
- **Content**: VSLAM integration, nav2-humanoid-config skill creation
- **Skill**: Persona + Questions + Principles for humanoid Nav2 configuration

### Lesson 8: Creating Behavior Tree Design Skill
- **Estimated time**: 150 minutes
- **Layer**: 3 (Intelligence Design)
- **Content**: BT pattern extraction, behavior-tree-design skill creation
- **Skill**: Persona + Questions + Principles for BT design

### Lesson 9: Capstone - Autonomous Humanoid Navigation
- **Estimated time**: 240 minutes
- **Layer**: 4 (Spec-Driven Integration)
- **Content**: Full Part 3 integration, all 6 skills applied, validation procedure
- **Success criteria**: 10m autonomous navigation, obstacle avoidance, recovery

---

## Skills Created in Chapter 9

### nav2-humanoid-config
**Location**: `.claude/skills/nav2-humanoid-config/SKILL.md`
**Purpose**: Configure Nav2 for bipedal humanoid robots
**Principles**:
- Footprint from stance dimensions + 15% margin
- max_vel_y = 0.0 (mandatory)
- TEB planner (never Navfn alone)
- Conservative recovery speeds

### behavior-tree-design
**Location**: `.claude/skills/behavior-tree-design/SKILL.md`
**Purpose**: Design behavior trees for autonomous navigation
**Principles**:
- Hierarchical decomposition
- Recovery escalation (safest first)
- Rate limiting for expensive operations
- Failure testing methodology

---

## Cross-Chapter Integration Summary

### From Chapter 7 (Isaac Sim) → Chapter 9
- Environment: Photorealistic indoor simulation
- Sensors: Depth camera for obstacle layer
- Skills: isaac-sim-performance (real-time rendering)

### From Chapter 8 (VSLAM) → Chapter 9
- Localization: Isaac Visual SLAM provides map and pose
- TF: map → odom → base_link
- Skills: vslam-debugging, isaac-ros-performance

### Chapter 9 Capstone Integration
- Isaac Sim (environment + sensors)
- VSLAM (localization + mapping)
- Nav2 (planning + control + recovery)
- All 6 Part 3 skills applied
